abstract:
Subspace codes have received an increasing interest recently, due to their
application in error-correction for random network coding. In particular,
cyclic subspace codes are possible candidates for large codes with efficient
encoding and decoding algorithms. In this paper we consider such cyclic codes.
We provide constructions of optimal cyclic codes for which their codewords do
not have full length orbits. We further introduce a new way to represent
subspace codes by a class of polynomials called subspace polynomials. We
present some constructions of such codes which are cyclic and analyze their
parameters.
